backend/main.mo: Motoko backend canister managing products with add, search, sort, and admin-restricted seeding using access control.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing features, related files, components, and test IDs for deployment and configuration fixes.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Mapping of frontend file paths to short functional descriptions for documentation or build planning.
frontend/artifacts/.gitkeep: Placeholder file ensuring the artifacts directory is tracked in version control.
frontend/docs/LIVE_DEPLOYMENT_SMOKE_CHEC: Checklist for verifying a correct live Internet Computer deployment and frontend-backend connectivity.
frontend/docs/PLAY_STORE_TWA_GUIDE.md: Guide for packaging the PWA as an Android Trusted Web Activity and publishing it to Google Play Store.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base and theme variables defining global light/dark color palettes and component styling.
frontend/index.html: Base HTML template loading the PWA manifest, icons, metadata, and bootstrapping the React app.
frontend/public/env.json: Runtime configuration file specifying backend canister ID and network for the deployed frontend.
frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest: PWA manifest defining app metadata, icons, colors, display mode, and shortcuts.
frontend/public/offline.html: Standalone offline fallback page shown when the PWA cannot reach the network.
frontend/public/sw.js: Service worker implementing precaching, cache cleanup, network‑first fetching, and special handling for env.json and API requests.
frontend/scripts/twa-build-aab-release.s: Builds a signed release AAB using Bubblewrap, prompting for TWA directory and keystore details.
frontend/scripts/twa-build-apk-debug.sh: Builds a debug APK via Bubblewrap and copies it to an artifacts folder for easy installation or download.
frontend/scripts/twa-build-apk-release.s: Generates a signed release APK using Bubblewrap after validating project and keystore settings.
frontend/scripts/twa-init.sh: Initializes a Bubblewrap TWA project from the live manifest, performing prerequisite checks and setup prompts.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Sets up the React router, registers the service worker, runs a backend smoke check, and renders the app layout.
frontend/src/backend.did.ts: Empty placeholder for generated backend canister types.
frontend/src/components/admin/AdminProdu: Modal dialog for creating or editing a product, embedding the admin product form.
Handles product creation and editing with form validation, image upload, and submit logic.
Displays a table of products with edit, delete, and stock toggle actions, including confirmations.
frontend/src/components/ConfigErrorState: Displays a detailed UI explaining configuration errors and provides guidance and a retry option.
frontend/src/components/ProductCard.tsx: Renders a product card with image, pricing, stock status, and navigation to the product details page.
frontend/src/components/PwaInstallPrompt: Detects PWA install availability and shows an install button or fallback instructions, handling prompt events and install actions.
Displays a banner when a new service worker update is ready and lets users refresh to apply it.
frontend/src/components/StoreFooter.tsx: Renders the site footer with branding, quick links, and a copyright notice.
frontend/src/components/StoreHeader.tsx: Provides the main site header with navigation, authentication-aware links, mobile menu, and PWA install prompt.
frontend/src/components/StoreLayout.tsx: Wraps the store UI with header, footer, update banner, and config loading/error handling.
frontend/src/config/appConfig.ts: Defines deployment slug and basic app metadata for configuration.
frontend/src/config/index.ts: Handles loading, validating, and caching runtime config and creates backend canister actors.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Provides a React hook that creates and manages the backend actor, refreshing it on identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useEnvConfig.ts: Loads environment config via React Query and exposes loading and error state.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements Internet Identity auth context, handling login, logout, and identity persistence.
frontend/src/hooks/useProducts.ts: Provides React Query hooks to fetch and mutate products using the backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base styles and CSS variables defining light and dark theme color tokens.
frontend/src/lib/errors.ts: Defines a custom ConfigurationError class used for config validation failures.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Initializes React app with QueryClient and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/AdminPage.tsx: Admin UI for viewing, creating, editing, and managing products with authentication gating.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Home page with hero banner, featured products, and feature cards, loading product data and navigation actions.
frontend/src/pages/NotFoundPage.tsx: 404 page showing a not‑found message with buttons to navigate home or to products.
frontend/src/pages/ProductDetailsPage.ts: Displays detailed product info with loading, error, and not‑found states, plus navigation back to the products list.
frontend/src/pages/ProductsPage.tsx: Lists all products with search, sorting, loading skeletons, and error handling.
frontend/src/pwa/registerServiceWorker.t: Registers the service worker, handles update detection, and dispatches related browser events.
frontend/src/utils/imageToDataUrl.ts: Converts an image File into a base64 Data URL using FileReader.
frontend/src/utils/runtimeSmokeCheck.ts: Runs a non‑blocking backend connectivity check by attempting to fetch products and logging results.
frontend/src/utils/toUserMessage.ts: Transforms unknown errors into user‑friendly messages with special handling for common backend issues.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utilities for reading, storing, persisting, and clearing URL and session parameters, including hash‑based routing support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration enabling dark mode, custom colors, fonts, animations, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project metadata describing deployment issues, required fixes for canister ID configuration, and pending redeploy to the Internet Computer.
